description: From Middle English apeiren, from Old French empeirier (modern French empirer). See impair.

verbs.description: appair (third-person singular simple present appairs, present participle appairing, simple past and past participle appaired)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To make worse; to injure or damage.
examples: The ancient lawes, uſages, cuſtomes, and franchiſes of the Realm, have been, and be greatly appaired, blemiſhed, and confounded  […]

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To become impaired; to grow worse.
examples: I see the more that I them forbear
The worse they be from year to year;
